qas.question: What was the state capital of North Carolina in 1722?
What city became the capital of North Carolina in 1766?
Who was the governor of North carolina in 1767?
What was the name of the offices and residence built for William Tryon?
What central North carolina cuty was chosen for the capital in 1788?

context: During colonial times, <a0_0>Edenton<a0_0/> served as the state capital beginning in 1722, and <a1_0>New Bern<a1_0/> was selected as the capital in 1766. Construction of <a3_0>Tryon Palace<a3_0/>, which served as the residence and offices of the provincial governor <a2_0>William Tryon<a2_0/>, began in 1767 and was completed in 1771. In 1788 <a4_0>Raleigh<a4_0/> was chosen as the site of the new capital, as its central location protected it from attacks from the coast. Officially established in 1792 as both county seat and state capital, the city was named after Sir Walter Raleigh, sponsor of Roanoke, the "lost colony" on Roanoke Island.
